children.subject: Prof. Roychowdhury is teaching a course EE 219A this semester which might be interesting to you. Here is a schedule of what they covered the last time the course was taught. Math 128A might also be up your alley.

history.content:
<md>Hello EECS 101,

I am a second-year EECS major.  Recently, I have been getting interested in the idea of pursuing Computational Science and Engineering, specifically using computational methods for applications in physics and mechanical engineering. I was hoping if I could get some advice regarding what kind of upper-division course work I should try to take in EECS, MechE and Physics to get a broad foundation for grad school. I would also appreciate any general advice regarding this.

Thank you

Edit: I understand that this is a very broad request. I am still trying to figure out what I like and don't like.</md>
history.subject: Advice for getting into Computational Science and Engineering
